missions.name: Genesis
missions.description:
This feature allows new players to choose from key decisions of Game 1, in the form of an interactive comic. If you imported a Game 1 Shepard, your choices will just carry over (along with many more decisions unavailable to new Game 2 players). 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Cerberus Network DLC pack._*

missions.name: Arrival
missions.description:
Hackett has asked you to rescue a deep-cover operative, [megametracker://person?id=O2.Kenson], who is being held at a batarian outpost and who claims to have proof of a Reaper invasion. This mission is particularly significant to the Reaper story arc and I like to do it at the end of Game 2, since Game 3 opens with Shepard's Alliance trial regarding the actions taken here. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Arrival DLC pack._*

set.context: After activating the project to push the asteroid into the mass relay

options.trigger: Shoot Kenson (fails to stop her grenade).
"I did what I had to do."
"What I did saved a lot more."

missions.name: Rescue Kenson
missions.description:
One of the achievements for this DLC is to get to Kenson without engaging any batarians, so it is possible to sneak through the outpost, fighting only the varren. 

Use the power relay to the right to open the door into the outpost. When you reach the drop where the bridge is out, head down and activate the bridge control there to remedy it (killing the varren). Continue upstairs to the power relay (killing the varren) and turn it off also. Go past the security beams where you hear Dr. Kenson and find an explosive under an overhead pipe and shoot it. This will ignite vents across the building, but you can use valves placed conveniently nearby to redirect the plasma and move through. Go upstairs and outside. Sneak behind the truck to cut the power relay and disable the security beams, then climb up over the truck to go inside the door. Head to the hangar and use the controls to move the crane out of the way and then activate the vehicle lift below to access the lower level. Head back to Kenson's cell.

missions.name: Escape
missions.description: Kenson will find a console and work on a way out. You must protect her from waves of batarian attackers. Kenson will instruct you to close the door you came from, but once you do this, the batarians will just come in from another location. Once Kenson finishes, she will say that the hangar doors must be open. At this point, she will help in the battle. Shoot out the hangar door locks on each side.

missions.name: Tour Project Base
missions.description: The shuttle will take you back to Kenson's base and she will show you the work they have been doing. She will take you down to the artifact they found, and reveal that the whole team has been Indoctrinated and then they attack you.

missions.name: Destroy Mass Relay
missions.description: The shuttle will take you back to Kenson's base and she will show you the work they have been doing. She will take you down to the artifact they found, and reveal that the whole team has been Indoctrinated and then they attack you in five waves. If you survive the five waves, you get an achievement. If you don't, it's not that important because you always wake up in the Med Bay. You have a 1.5 hour countdown to finish, which is more than enough time for the following events, but you could try running it down if you want to.

missions.name: Escape Med Bay
missions.description: Head through the Med Bay to the living quarters and into the Mess Hall, taking out Kenson's forces as they attack. Get to the project control room and activate the engines. You have a few seconds to try to warn the colonists or contact the Normandy, but Kenson interrupts either way, notifying you that now she is going to blow up the whole asteroid to stop it. She starts a core meltdown.

missions.name: Cooling Rod A
missions.description: Head up the elevator to the Control Station A and talk to the VI, who will instruct you to insert the cooling rod there and then head over to Control Station B and do the same.

missions.name: Cooling Rod B
missions.description: Head down the elevator and abort the plasma venting to unlock the door. When you come to the next locked door, shoot the explosive crate next to it and go that way. Use the security console to override the lock and go up the next two elevators. Down the hall is Cooling Station B. When you have inserted the second cooling rod, you run into Kenson and she will blow herself up whatever you do, and the explosion will knock you out.

missions.name: Escape
missions.description: When you wake up, you only have 30 minutes left until impact. The VI informs you that communications are down and you need to go to the communications tower or take a shuttle. Head up the elevator and outside. You will have a scenic view of the approaching mass relay as you fight through more troops and a heavy mech. The shuttle takes off without you. When you reach the comm controls, Harbinger intercepts the communications with a menacing warning. Then the Normandy picks you up and you escape just before the relay (and everything in the Bahak system) is destroyed.

missions.name: Normandy Crash Site
missions.description:
_"Scans confirm the wreckage of SSV Normandy on the planet's surface. No life signs or mechanical activity detected. Stable landing zone located amid the crash site."_ 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Cerberus Network DLC pack._*

missions.name: Explore Site
missions.description: There are several locations you may want to visit and view flashbacks to Game 1. These are all optional to the mission.

missions.name: Find Dog Tags
missions.description: Gather the dog tags of at least 16 of the 20 missing crewmembers.

missions.name: Place Monument
missions.description: When you are done gathering the dog tags and exploring the wreckage, place the monument and return to the shuttle.

missions.name: Overlord
missions.description:
Project Overlord has stopped communicating with Cerberus. When you land to investigate, [Dr. Archer|megametracker://person?id=O2.ArcherG] reveals that the VI has gone rogue and is trying to upload its program offsite via the satellite transmission dish. 

You may want to complete [megametracker://mission?id=DLC2.Firewalker] first, as an introduction to operating the Hammerhead exploration vehicle. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Overlord DLC pack._*

set.context: After Dr. Archer shoots at you for removing David from the experiment

missions.name: Overlord: Hermes Station
missions.description: Speak to Dr. Archer and prevent the VI from using the satellite dish.

missions.name: Retract Satellite Dish
missions.description: Enter the facility and head down the ramp. Shoot out the cracked window and through that room. The door on the right leads to the dish controls. Retract the dish.

missions.name: Take Tram
missions.description: The VI overrides your actions, and now you must destroy the satellite dish to stop it. Head out through the mess hall, which is now overrun with geth. You will want to head upstairs and make your way to the tram. Activate it and travel to the dish location.

missions.name: Cross Walkway to Dish
missions.description:
Note: Despite what Dr. Archer says, this is not a timed mission. 

Head across the catwalks, eliminating the small group of geth that attack you. Activate the walkway controls and cross over to the dish itself. There will be a major battle here.

missions.name: Destroy Dish
missions.description: There are four capacitors spaced across the edge of the dish and you will need to destroy three of them to take down the dish. Destroying each capacitor will spawn a new geth attack.

missions.name: Speak to Archer
missions.description: Archer reveals that Project Overlord's goal was integrating a human mind into a VI. Archer chose his brother, but [David|megametracker://person?id=O2.ArcherD] was overpowered by the VI. Three override signals must be sent to disable the VI, located at Atlas Station. Archer will take care of Hermes station, but you must send the override signals from Prometheus and Vulcan stations.

missions.name: Overlord: Vulcan Station
missions.description: Activate the override switch inside Vulcan Station, which is a geothermal facility located atop a volcano.

events.id: Completed: Overlord: Vulcan and Prometheus Station

missions.name: Outpost
missions.description: Take the Hammerhead toward the Vulcan station, using steam vents for elevation boosts, and avoiding lava. At the outpost you will be blocked from continuing, so exit, enter the facility and eliminate the geth there. Use the console to reactivate the malfunctioning valve. Get back in the Hammerhead and use the steam vents to continue on.

missions.name: Station Interior
missions.description: Once you have reached Vulcan Station, exit the Hammerhead and enter the facility. You will have to fight many mechs of various sizes to reach the override switch. Activate it and return to the Hammerhead.

missions.name: Overlord: Prometheus Station
missions.description: Activate the override switch inside Prometheus Station, which was constructed inside a downed geth ship.

events.id: Completed: Overlord: Vulcan and Prometheus Station

missions.name: Take Out Shield
missions.description: When you reach Prometheus Station, it is protected by a shield. You will need to take out the shield generators, which unfortunately are also behind the shield. There is also a cannon targeting the Hammerhead. You can trick the cannon into firing on the shield generators, or use the Hammerhead's missiles to take them out.

missions.name: Cross to Control Station
missions.description:
There is initially no danger entering the facility, as all the geth are locked in stasis. The VI will lock doors behind you as you go. But the large room housing the control station has been shifted to prevent access. You must move the platforms to create a bridge to the control station. 

Move the middle piece up one space. Move the left piece right one and up one. Cross and activate the override.

missions.name: Escape
missions.description: Now you have to fight your way through all the geth you saw on the way in. When you are finally outside, reboard the Hammerhead.

missions.name: Overlord: Atlas Station
missions.description: Take out the VI inside Atlas Station.

events.id: Completed: Overlord: Vulcan and Prometheus Station

missions.name: Elevator
missions.description: The facility can be reached under the waterfall. Exit the Hammerhead and head inside. The elevator is damaged, so you will need to call it several times to convince it to come to your level, level 7. be prepared for all the geth inside when it opens. When they are dealt with, take the elevator down. It will crash, but you get to level 1 at least. Head down the hall and open the panel to cut off network access.

missions.name: Inside The VI
missions.description: When you try to disconnect Atlas Station, you are pulled into a virtual reality. It will alternate between green visions of the past and orange present where you can be killed by the geth. You will be fighting alone here. Head down the hallway and make you way to the second elevator, operated by a computer, and also full of geth. When they are dispatched, take the elevator down.

missions.name: David
missions.description: David is attempting to upload himself to the Normandy. You will alternate between fighting geth, shooting out the control nodes travelling down the cables to David, and shooting at the core (ie, David), whenever its shields drop. Once the core is destroyed, you are returned to reality and you can see the real David hooked up to the VI.

missions.name: Aftermath
missions.description: Dr. Archer shows up and, despite everything that has happened, he wants to continue the experiment. You can talk him down and in the end have two choices: to take David with you and entrust him to Jon Grissom Academy, where he will later reappear in Game 3 (Paragon), or leave him with Dr. Archer where he will later die (Renegade).

missions.name: Project Firewalker
missions.description:
A survey ship with a prototype exploration vehicle has gone missing. Cerberus would like the vehicle recovered, along with any news of the researchers aboard. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Cerberus Network DLC pack._*

missions.name: Project Firewalker: Rosalie Lost
missions.description: After you are dropped off by the wreckage, bypass the cargo computer to open the crate and retrieve the Hammerhead. Then there is a basic gathering assignment as an introduction to the Hammerhead's controls. Follow the instructions to collect all the research packets.

missions.name: Project Firewalker: Geth Incursion
missions.description:
_"Planetary scans detect signals from sensor pods left on the planet's surface. These pods may contain valuable data. Warning: Surface temperatures are extremely low. Advise keeping Hammerhead exposure to the cold at an absolute minimum."_ 

You must scan 10 sites before the Hammerhead freezes - each scan will warm the Hammerhead slightly.

missions.name: Project Firewalker: Survey Sites Located
missions.description: There are five sites you must scan on this planet, while avoiding or destroying various geth forces.

missions.name: Project Firewalker: Volcano Station
missions.description:
_"Research station detected within volcano on planet's surface. The research station's data storage systems are still active and may contain valuable information. Warning: Volcano is unstable. Advise extreme caution."_ 

Take the Hammerhead, scanning what sites you can, to the research station, which you must explor on foot. Go to the control center and activate the sensors. This will trigger seismic activity and you will have to find an alternate exit. Get back in the Hammerhead and head up and through the tunnel. There is a dropoff when the tunnel ends, then jump across to the next platform and then to the next tunnel. You have to jump across at the end of this tunnel also, and then it cuts to sliding into the Normandy hanger bay and you are done.

missions.name: Project Firewalker: Prothean Site
missions.description: _"Prothean artifacts detected on planet's [sic] surface. Artifact site is protected by a powerful energy barrier. Scans detected muted mechanical signatures consistent with hidden automated defenses."_ Take out the barrier around the dig site by destroying the shield generators, while fighting off rocket drones. Proceed on foot down into the dig site. You will need to bypass the computer to access the relic. Examine the relic. It will shrink and later you can find it on the coffee table in your cabin.

missions.name: Lair of the Shadow Broker
missions.description:
In recovering Shepard's body, Liara ended up losing her partner, [megametracker://person?id=O2.Feron]. Feron was an agent of the Shadow Broker, who betrayed him to help Liara. She wants to track down the Shadow Broker and find out what happened to Feron. 

Complete [megametracker://mission?id=A2.I.TheObserver] first, or you will lose the opportunity. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Lair of the Shadow Broker DLC pack._*

set.context: Giving the Cerberus intel to Liara
After finding the backup disk in Liara's apartment

conversationRewards.context: After realizing Vasir is working for the Shadow Broker

set.context: When Vasir takes a hostage in the cafe

options.trigger: Reassure Liara that you will rescue Feron.
Chide Liara for being so callous.
Try to convince Liara to take a moment for some personal time.

set.context: When Liara takes over as the new Shadow Broker

options.trigger: (Hug her.) - And kiss a Game 1 love interest Liara.

missions.name: The Veteran (DLC)
missions.description: *_This assignment was released as part of the Cerberus Network DLC pack._*

missions.name: Zaeed: The Price of Revenge (DLC)
missions.description:
Before Zaeed can commmit himself to helping you defeat the Collectors, he needs your help finishing some prior business he has on Zorya at a Blue Suns refinery. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Cerberus Network DLC pack._*

set.context: After the first encounter with Vido at the gatehouse

options.trigger: Punch Zaeed in the face (the _Paragon_ response).

set.context: After the worker begs for help
When Zaeed demands you help him pursue Vido and leave the workers to die
At the end of the Paragon path

options.trigger: "I don't want you on my ship."

missions.name: Southern Gatehouse
missions.description: Make your way to the southern gatehouse. There will be some fighting in the first clearing. When the mercenaries are cleared out, follow the path left and activate the bridge controls. Continue up the path and the gatehouse in in a huge clearing. You will have to bypass the door to break inside, where there is a cutscene with Zaeed's enemy Vido.

missions.name: Paragon/Renegade Decision
missions.description:
When you have eliminated the initial forces at the gatehouse and continued through the rapidly deteriorating wreckage outside the refinery, you will reach a [door|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Att.Ism.Fai.Zorya&title=Morality%20Choice&location=895x595] that leads to a single-outcome morality decision. To earn Zaeed's loyalty, you either have to select the Renegade option and leave the refinery workers to die terribly (you will hear them screaming throughout the rest of the mission), or - if you have enough Paragon points - at the very end you may have the option to *charm* Zaeed into accepting your Paragon decision. Additionally, there is one upgrade on this mission: a Heavy Weapons Upgrade for Paragon or an Assault Rifle Damage for Renegade. 

Since the Paragon required is scaled by level, it is difficult to know until the end if you have enough points. So if you want to keep Zaeed, your best chances are to suck it up and go Renegade.

missions.name: Paragon Route (Optional)
missions.description: Put out the refinery fire. You will rejoin with the Renegade route just before the final battle.

missions.name: Renegade Route (Optional)
missions.description: Pursue Vido

missions.name: Pursue Vido
missions.description:
Fight the final battle at the refinery to reach Vido. 

If you selected the Renegade route, you will catch up with Vido at the end and Zaeed will take his revenge. The refinery is destroyed along with everyone in it, but you have Zaeed's loyalty. 

If you selected the Paragon route, the workers are saved but Zaeed is injured and Vido gets away. If you don't have enough Paragon points, you will lose Zaeed's loyalty. Additionally, if you complete this assignment *after* the final Collector mission (the "suicide mission"), then there is an additional option to leave Zaeed to die.

missions.name: The Master Thief (DLC)
missions.description:
Kasumi left a message for you in one of the Citadel advertizing pillars. Listen to [the message|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.C2.ZakeraWardL27&title=Advertisement&location=1200x1580] and she will join the squad. 

*_This assignment was released as part of the Stolen Memory DLC pack._*

missions.name: Kasumi: Stealing Memory (DLC)
missions.description:
Kasumi Goto's former partner, [Keiji|megametracker://person?id=O2.Keiji], was killed by the ruthless arms dealer, [megametracker://person?id=O2.Hock], for a valuable neural implant, called a graybox, containing dangerous secrets. Kasumi needs your help to break into Hock's vault and recover the graybox.

*_This assignment was released as part of the Stolen Memory DLC pack._*

set.context: Talking to Kasumi on the way to the party
Keeping Hock talking (for the voice recording)
After saying: "I understand." or "Not a problem." or "Just this once."

options.trigger: "I think we could be allies." or "[Flirt] You're not offensive."

set.context: After saying: "Have time to talk?" or "You trust all these people?"
While Hock is lecturing you in the vault

options.trigger: Shoot up some of the expensive art and piss Hock off.

set.context: In the shuttle with Kasumi afterwards

options.trigger: "Destroy the graybox." or "It's what he wants."

set.context: After convincing Kasumi to destroy the graybox

missions.name: Break Into The Vault
missions.description: Hock has the best security measures in place to protect his vault. You will need to acquire several things before you can break in.

missions.name: Find Vault Password
missions.description: The vault password is changed daily. Break into the security room and locate the [datapad|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.OuC.Ser.Bol.Bek.1Home&title=Donovan%20Hock&location=173x1494] with the vault password stored on it.

missions.name: Record Hock's Voice
missions.description: The vault password is only valid in Hock's own voice. Keep [Hock|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.OuC.Ser.Bol.Bek.1Home&title=Donovan%20Hock&location=599x1289] talking until Kasumi gets enough to reconstruct the voice password for the Vault.
sideEffects: This same ploy was used in the 1992 movie [Sneakers|https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0105435/], where Mary McDonnell (Battlestar Galactica) has to trick her date into saying all the words in his corporate voice passport.

missions.name: Get Hock's DNA
missions.description:
To get Hock's DNA, you will need to break into his private rooms. There are two ways to get there: 

1) Use the [datapad|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.OuC.Ser.Bol.Bek.1Home&title=Datapad&location=398x810] with information about Chief Roe to convince the guard to let you in. 

2) Jump down from the [balcony|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.OuC.Ser.Bol.Bek.1.Balcony&type=Map] to outside of the mansion and then shoot the glass to get back inside the hallway outside Hock's rooms. 

The DNA you need is on the Wine Glass, the Couch Cushion, and the Datapad. 

Do not touch the [Alarm Clock|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.OuC.Ser.Bol.Bek.1Home&title=Alarm%20Clock&location=1803x1199] or more guards will show up.

missions.name: Cut the Power
missions.description: Cut the power to the kinetic barrier by pulling the [statuette|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.OuC.Ser.Bol.Bek.1Home&title=Statuette&location=365x1194] on the wall.

missions.name: Find Keiji's Graybox
missions.description: The vault is full of valuable art. Locate the graybox. The signal will pulse louder and more rapidly the closer you get to the graybox. As soon as you take the graybox, Hock's forces will attack.
sideEffects: If you look into the next room past the Statue of Liberty's head, you can see two Conduit scultptures, probably modelled after the one on the Citadel in Game 1 (where it was assumed to be ancient Prothean art).

After examining the Statue of Liberty's head, you are rewarded with a [codex entry|https://masseffect.wikia.com/wiki/Codex/The_Master_Thief:_Kasumi's_Secrets#Lady_Liberty] of its history, detailing how secessionists blew up the statue preceding the Second American Civil War.

missions.name: Escape Outside
missions.description: Hock seals you in the garage. To escape, you need to make a new door. Make your way to the factory and use the [canon|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.OuC.Ser.Bol.Bek.2.Canon&type=Map] on the [volatile canisters|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.OuC.Ser.Bol.Bek.2Vault&title=Volatile%20Canisters&location=1018x903] to get out to the truck loading bay and from there to the wharf.

missions.name: Destroy Hock's Gunship
missions.description: Hock's mercenaries will attack you in waves while his personal gunship attacks you. You can attack the gunship to speed up the process, but his shields won't fall until Kasumi's cut-scene. At that point, you can destroy the gunship and complete the mission. Take the shuttle when you are done looting the wharf.

missions.name: Archangel
missions.description: A formidable mercenary commander and expert sniper, Archangel is currently involved in a one-man war against the three gangs of Omega. You must extract him from this battle alive if you want him on the squad.

set.context: Ridiculed by the mercenary recruiter (if Shepard is female)

options.trigger: Taunt the mercenary on the size of his gun.

set.context: Talking to the young man who is signing on after you
Talking to Garrus on the Normandy afterwards

missions.name: Sign on to Attack Archangel
missions.description:
If you have not already spoken to Aria, you must first make a token appearance before the ruler of Omega before you can begin the Archangel mission. Then you can sign up as a freelancer with the mercenary groups, to be frontline fodder in the attack on Archangel. 

After signing on, you can pick up a ride to Archangel's base in Kima District with a Blue Suns driver at the [Transport Depot|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Ome.Sah.Ome.1.Depot&type=Map].

missions.name: Sabotage Mercenary Attack
missions.description: Before you head out to find Archangel, look around for ways to sabotage the mercenary attack.

missions.name: Sabotage YMIR Mech
missions.description: Bypass the heavy mech to make it turn on the mercenaries during the battle.

missions.name: Sabotage Gunship
missions.description:
Talk to Cathka while he is repairing the gunship. There will be a renegade interrupt to injure Cathka and thereby prevent any repairs to the ship. 

_Note: talking to Cathka/Cathka's Assistant will move the story along to the attack on Archangel's base. You will no longer have access to the mercenary area after the conversation._

missions.name: Meet Archangel
missions.description: Turn on the other mercenaries during the attack (don't shoot Archangel!). When they are down, go upstairs to talk to Archangel. He has a health status bar that will appear throughout the rest of the mission. If it falls to zero, the mission fails.

missions.name: Eclipse Attack
missions.description:
From the balcony, fend off the attack by Eclipse. If you sabotaged the YMIR mech, it will assist in the battle. Don't let it live too long though, or it will revert to its original programming and attack you. 

In the final wave, the head of the Eclipse forces, Jaroth, will attack. Once he is dead and the remaining mercenaries killed, you are free to explore Archangel's base for loot.

missions.name: Blood Pack Attack
missions.description:
After you speak to Garrus, Blood Pack mercenaries attack, breaching the tunnels under the base. Garrus instructs you to go down to the lower levels and close the three emergency shutters to keep them out. 

You have to decide whether to take your full squad with you or leave someone with Garrus. Leaving a squadmate will improve his chances of survival. 

Approaching each shutter triggers an endless stream of mercenaries to attack (they will not attack until you approach, so there is no time pressure). They will not stop coming until you close the shutter. When all three are closed, Garrus will alert you that he is being attacked upstairs. 

There will be another massive attack by Blood Pack, led by Garm. Kill him, and delay speaking to Garrus until you are ready for the next stage.

missions.name: Blue Suns Attack
missions.description: The Blue Suns attack with the gunship (if sabotaged, it will be down to half its armor). The gunship will drop mercenaries right into the upper room, including elite attacker Jentha. Blue Suns leader Tarak will drop in a cutscene and attack Garrus, and Garrus is shot by a rocket. You must then take down the gunship before Garrus dies.

missions.name: Debrief
missions.description: Talk to Garrus on the Normandy.

missions.name: The Assassin
missions.description: Thane Krios is a drell trained from childhood as an elite assassin, proficient in both long-range sniping kills and close infiltration. He has slowed his activities in recent years but is rumored to have a target on Illium.

set.context: Talking to the salarian workers, Daroth and Shelum

options.trigger: Throw the trooper off the roof.

set.context: Talking to the salarians, Telon and Chesith
If Shepard helped Nassana in Game 1

missions.name: Talk to Liara
missions.description: Liara has information on Thane Krios and his target on Illium.

missions.name: Talk to Seryna
missions.description: Seryna used to be head of security for Nassana Dantius. After she confronted Nassana about a series of assassinations, she was fired. She provided information to Thane and has an idea where he has gone.

missions.name: Level One
missions.description: There are mechs and mercenaries on level one. Once you have eliminated them, go talk to the [surviving salarian|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Cre.Tas.Ill.2Darius&title=Wounded%20Salarian&location=488x1105], who tells you that Nassana sent the mechs to get rid of all the night workers in the second tower, a paranoid attempt to eliminate any threats.

missions.name: Level Two
missions.description: After going up the ramp to level two, you will need to fight off four waves of mercenary/mech attacks. Afterwards, you can go talk to some [salarian workers|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Cre.Tas.Ill.2Darius&title=Salarian%Workers&location=695x545], locked in a room by a mysterious benefactor. Warning: there is another battle as soon as you request the elevator to go to the next level.

missions.name: Level Three
missions.description: After clearing out the room, talk to the [salarian workers|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Cre.Tas.Ill.2Darius&title=Salarian%Workers&location=1291x590] hiding in the side room. You can also annoy Nassana over the [comm terminal|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Cre.Tas.Ill.2Darius&title=Salarian%Workers&location=1279x389].

missions.name: Roof
missions.description: Fight your way across the roof and over the bridge to Tower One. There is a final wave of attackers coming from Nassana's penthouse.

missions.name: Finish Mission
missions.description: There is a cutscene when you enter the penthouse and you will finally meet Thane.

missions.name: The Convict
missions.description: Jack, a powerful human biotic, is being held on the prison ship Purgatory. Cerberus has negotiated for the prisoner's release.

set.context: When the guard demands Shepard's weapons
Speaking to the guard outside the first prisoner cell
After intervening in the prisoner beating
After Warden Kuril reveals his plan to detain Shepard in Outprocessing

options.context: (If this was discussed in a previous conversation with the warden)

set.context: Debrief with Jack on the Normandy
When Jack asks for her Cerberus files
Checking on Jack in the Engineering sub-level

options.context: (If you did share the Cerberus files)
(If you did not share the Cerberus files)

set.context: Checking on Jack in the Engineering sub-level

options.context: (If you did share the Cerberus files)
(If you did not share the Cerberus files)

missions.name: Facility Tour
missions.description: The guards of Purgatory will demand that your team relinquish its weapons before entering the facility. However, Warden Kuril will allow you to enter armed, and gives you a brief tour of the ship. He then leaves you to look around yourself (with most areas of the ship still unavailable). You can speak to a [prison guard|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Hou.Osu.Purgatory&title=Prison%20Guard&location=697x1327], or a [prisoner|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Hou.Osu.Purgatory&title=Prisoner&location=639x1295] or another [prisoner|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Hou.Osu.Purgatory&title=Prisoner&location=583x1295]. When you are ready, head over to outprocessing to pick up Jack.

missions.name: Spring The Trap
missions.description: Warden Kuril has no intention of letting Jack go, and has decided to lock up Shepard as well. You'll need to fight your way out of the outprocessing room and find Jack yourself.

missions.name: Super Max Wing
missions.description: Get to the security room and use the console to override security across the ship. This will release Jack, and then you just have to catch up to her. You will have to fight both prisoners and guards - and, in both of the big rooms, an YMIR mech - as the facility literally falls apart around you.

missions.name: Warden Kuril
missions.description: Destroy the three shield generators feeding the shields around Warden Kuril, while fighting off waves of attackers. Then you can attack the warden directly.

missions.name: The Justicar
missions.description: Samara is a justicar, a rare member of an asari monastic group trained in enhanced combat biotics alongside standard weapons. Samara was recently sighted on Illium, outside normal asari space.

missions.name: Talk to Dara
missions.description: Samara registered with Tracking Officer Dara before heading to the spaceport. Talk to Dara to follow the justicar, or just hail a cab at the [megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Cre.Tas.Ill.1.Cab&type=Map].

missions.name: Talk to Anaya
missions.description: Detective Anaya is investigating the murder at the spaceport. She reveals that Samara is there, and that Anaya has been ordered to detain her, something Anaya is afraid to do. She is eager to help you, in the hopes that you can persuade Samara to leave Illium.

missions.name: Find Samara
missions.description:
You now have permission to enter the crime scene. As you enter pass the guards, check the terminal on the right for [masseffectracker://mission?id=MA2.I.StolenGoodsFound]. Continue through the hallways until you reach a closed door. Samara is behind it.

After the cut scene, Samara is detained by Detective Anaya. She consents to wait one day, but after that she will kill the detective if she interferes with the justicar's mission. If you could complete Samara's mission first, Anaya would *really* appreciate it.

missions.name: Talk to Pitne For
missions.description: Pitne For, a volus outside the police station, is being detained on Illium pending the investigation into his business partner's murder. Once he confesses that he has been smuggling toxic drugs onto Illium, he will offer you his pass card into the base.

missions.name: Eclipse Hideout
missions.description: You will head up through four levels, with several canisters of the toxic drug Pitne For smuggled in. If they explode, the resulting gas will briefly boost your biotics, but it is lethal under any longer exposure.

missions.name: Elnora (Optional)
missions.description: On the first level, you may meet Eclipse recruit [megametracker://person?id=O2.Elnora]. You can kill her or let her go. Later on, you will run across [Elnora's Diary|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Cre.Tas.Ill.3Spaceport&title=Elnora%27s%20Diary&location=1177x1456] where she recounts her first murder, likely Pitne For's business partner.

missions.name: Gunship
missions.description: Here you will have to take down the Eclipse gunship.

missions.name: Shipping Manifest (Optional)
missions.description: This is the document Pitne For wants back so badly. It begins assignment [megametracker://mission?id=A2.I.SmugglingEvidence].

missions.name: Niftu Cal
missions.description: You will encounter a drug-addled member of the volus merchant group, [megametracker://person?id=O2.NiftuCal]. He has been dosed by the Eclipse with some of the drugs they were smuggling, which have temporarily granted him biotic powers. You have the option to send him in first to attack Wasea, with amusing - if tragic - consequences.

missions.name: Captain Wasea's Data
missions.description: Once you have defeated Wasea and her mercenaries, you can find the data Samara needs on a datapad on Wasea's desk.

missions.name: The Professor
missions.description: Recruit the salarian Mordin Solus, currently operating a Medical Clinic in the slums of Omega. He may have the technology to counter the Collector attacks.
sideEffects: Acquiring Mordin unlocks the tech lab on the Normandy, opening up the ability to research upgrades acquired during other missions. It is a good strategy to complete this dossier first.

set.context: Speaking to the sick batarian just inside the slums

options.trigger: Heal the angry batarian with omni-gel.

set.context: Telling the refugee to go to the medical clinic
Hypocritically demanding the humans stop looting
Meeting Mordin for the first time
Hypocritically demanding the humans stop looting
Talking to the vorcha in the environmental control room
Confirming Mordin is joining the team
(If Shepard saved Daniel and let the Batarians leave)
(If Shepard saved Daniel and killed the batarians)
(If Shepard doesn't bother with Daniel at all)
Talking to Mordin on the Normandy afterwards
When Mordin asks about Cerberus' questionable past

options.context: Not using an interrupt while Mordin is talking

set.TODO: Move this to a misc assignment for odd morality like this
set.context:
Speaking to Captain Gavorn back in the Omega Merchant District, when he asks about all the dead vorcha in the Quarantine Zone. 

(You may need to speak to the vorcha Shisk near Kenn's Salvage first.)

missions.name: Go to The Quarantine Zone
missions.description: The Quarantine Zone is restricted. To convince the turian guard to allow your group inside will require some persuasion. If your morality is not high enough, you will have to kill the guards.

missions.name: Help the Batarian Victim
missions.description: There is a sick batarian lying alone in the slums. You have the opportunity to help him.

missions.name: Fight to the Clinic
missions.description: The Blood Pack and Blue Suns mercenaries fighting in this area (Kokomo Plaza) are going to make it difficult for you to reach Mordin's clinic.

missions.name: Speak to Mordin
missions.description:
Find Mordin inside the Medical Clinic. He will explain that he can't help you until the plague is taken care of. He has a cure, but needs a way to distribute it. Just then, the Blood Pack shut off the air circulation system. Mordin realizes this is an opportunity - you can turn the air circulation back on and use it to distribute the cure. 

He also mentions that his assistant Daniel has gone missing ([megametracker://mission?id=MA2.O.MissingAssistant]), and he'd appreciate it if you could find him and bring him back to the clinic.

missions.name: Fight to Environmental Control
missions.description: The Blood Pack controls all the territory between the Clinic and Environmental Control. There are two large rooms and some smaller encounters. Directly after the first big fight, you will walk past the room where [Daniel|megametracker://mission?id=A2.O.MissingAssistant] is being held.

missions.name: Distribute The Cure
missions.description: Once you take down the first group holding Environmental Control, you can program the computer to distribute Mordin's cure. You will immediately be attacked again. When the room is clear, pick which of the two ventilation controls to turn on first - the order doesn't matter and the attacks at each are fairly similar. Once you have turned both controls back on, the mission ends and you are returned to the Medical Clinic.

missions.name: Debrief
missions.description: Once you have spoken to Mordin at the Medical Clinic and he has agreed to join the squad, you are free to complete other Omega missions. When you do finally return to the Normandy, speak to Mordin to wrap up the final dialog options.

missions.name: Tali
missions.description:
Tali'Zorah, the quarian engineer who helped Shepard defeat Saren in Game 1, is currently on a classified assignment for the Migrant Fleet on Haestrom, a planet in geth-controlled space. 

Due to intense solar radiation on Haestrom, prolonged exposure to sunlight will damage shields.

set.context: Talking to Tali on the communications console
Talking to Kal'Reegar during fight with geth Colossus
Talking to Kal'Reegar after the fight (if he's alive)

missions.name: Open Gate
missions.description: The only hazard until this point is the solar radiation.

missions.name: Answer Radio
missions.description: Eliminate the geth attackers while avoiding solar exposure. Then make contact with the Quarians via the radio.

missions.name: Clear Fallen Pillar
missions.description:
Gather the two demolition charges and use them to clear the pillar that has collapsed just in front of the next door. Take cover or move a distance away after setting the charges. 

While gathering the charges, you may also want to listen to Tali's journals [here|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Far.Dho.Haestrom&title=Tali%27s%20Journal&location=1246x1210], [here|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Far.Dho.Haestrom&title=Tali%27s%20Journal&location=601x1066], and [here|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Far.Dho.Haestrom&title=Tali%27s%20Journal&location=1719x271]

missions.name: Activate Comm Control
missions.description: The next door is locked. Contact Tali through the Communication Control and she will unlock it for you.

missions.name: Open Shutters
missions.description: There is a large open courtyard to fight through. Enter the room at the far end and activate the shutter control to open up the next area.

missions.name: Defeat Geth Colossus
missions.description: You can find [Kal'Reegar|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Far.Dho.Haestrom&title=Kal%27Reegar&location=837x457] wounded just down the stairs from the shutter control. He will offer strategy advice against the geth Colossus and may help in the fight, depnding on conversation choices. _Note: if Kal'Reegar is still attacking the Colossus when it powers down, it will kill him when it comes back online._

missions.name: Find Tali
missions.description: Enter the final room and rescue Tali.

options.trigger: "Start running." or "Get out of here." or "You won't be around to see it."

set.context: Talking to Rana (if she survived Game 1)

options.trigger: "I did what I had to do."

set.context: Discussing bring the tank aboard the Normandy

options.trigger: "He's hard to pass up." or "Professional jealousy, Mordin?"
"Is he worth the headache?" or "That's my call."

missions.name: Wounded Mercenary
missions.description: After the first fight, you will run into a wounded mercenary who can provide some information about what is going on.

missions.name: Tank-Grown Krogan
missions.description: Stay in cover while fighting the mercenaries at a distance. You will encounter a passive krogan who can tell you more about Okeer's work on Korlus.

missions.name: Research Base
missions.description: From here you will be fighting a mix of mercenaries and tank-bred krogan. Fight your way through the buildings to make your way to the lab.

missions.name: Okeer
missions.description: If you let [megametracker://person?id=O1.Rana] live in Game 1, she can be found in the research lab's antechamber and will tell you how she escaped Saren's base and what she is doing working for Okeer. In the next room is Okeer. He agrees to help you with the Collectors if you kill his patron, Jedore, first.

missions.name: Jedore
missions.description: Defeat Jedore and her forces.

missions.name: Okeer's Son
missions.description: Return to Okeer. You will be too late to save him, but you can save his last, perfect, tank-bred krogan.

missions.name: Garrus: Eye for an Eye
missions.description: Garrus lost his entire squad on Omega after they were betrayed by one of their own, Sidonis. He has found out that a criminal named Fade helped Sidonis disappear. Find Fade, locate Sidonis, and help Garrus find closure.

set.context: Threatening the volus in the warehouse
Speaking to Garrus in the cab on the way to meet Sidonis

options.trigger: "I don't know." or "You sure about this?"

set.context: Parting words to Sidonis if he survives

conversationRewards.context: Speaking to Garrus after Sidonis is killed

set.context: Speaking to Garrus after Sidonis leaves alive

missions.name: Grunt: Rite of Passage
missions.description: Grunt finds it difficult to control his rage. He needs to undergo the krogan Rite of Passage.

missions.name: Jack: Subject Zero
missions.description: Jack was raised in a Cerberus facility, tortured by the Cerberus staff and the other children there as well. It was long since abandoned and she wants to go back and blow it up.

missions.name: Jacob: The Gift of Greatness
missions.description: After going missing ten years ago with Jacob's father onboard, the Hugo Gernsback sent out a distress call last week from the planet Aeia.

options.trigger: Save the woman from the hunters.

set.context: Deciding what to do with Captain Taylor

options.trigger: "Leave him in the hell he made."

missions.name: Beacon
missions.description: Locate the ship's beacon. Explore the wreckage for ship's logs: [Officer's Log|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Ros.Alp.2175Aeia&title=Officer%27s%20Log&location=343x1455], [Crew Log|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Ros.Alp.2175Aeia&title=Crew%20Log&location=227x1275], [Crew Log|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Ros.Alp.2175Aeia&title=Crew%20Log&location=267x1187], [Doctor's Log|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Ros.Alp.2175Aeia&title=Doctor%27s%20Log&location=327x1247].

missions.name: Survivor
missions.description: Meet the first survivor. You will be attacked by hunters immediately after.

missions.name: Statue
missions.description: You will find an encampment with female survivors and a strange statue. As you move to the back of the camp, mechs will attack. Afterwards, you can talk the [Doctor|megametracker://maplocation?id=G.Ter.Ros.Alp.2175Aeia&title=Doctor&location=923x783] and learn more about what has happened in the past decade.

missions.name: Inactive Mech
missions.description: Bypass the mech to blow up the barricade and continue down the path.

missions.name: Dead Bodies
missions.description: When you come upon the dead bodies, Ronald Taylor will come over the loudspeaker, saying the crew mutinied. You will be attacked by more mechs on your way up the path.

missions.name: Large Encampment
missions.description: There is a larger encampment surrounded by large walls. Guards and mechs will attack, including an YMIR Mech.

missions.name: Ronald Taylor
missions.description: Head over to the beach where Ronald Taylor is waiting.

missions.name: Legion: A House Divided
missions.description: The geth are divided into two camps, one committed to co-existing with organic life and the other to destroying it. The latter group, the Heretics, has found a Reaper virus and modified it to force all geth to join their side. Legion asks you to board Heretic Station with him and destroy the virus.

missions.name: Miranda: The Prodigal
missions.description: Miranda reveals that she has a younger sister, [megametracker://person?id=O2.Oriana], a genetic clone created by her wealthy and ruthless father. Miranda has been keeping Oriana's location secret, but her father has finally located her. You need to reach the girl before Miranda's father does.

conversationRewards.context: Speaking to Miranda on the elevator (first time)
conversationRewards.trigger: "We need to get to your sister."

set.context: Speaking to Miranda on the elevator (second time)
Speaking to Miranda on the elevator (third time)

options.context: If Miranda did not kill Niket

missions.name: Talk to Lanteia
missions.description: Talk to [megametracker://person?id=O2.Lanteia] at the Eternity Bar on Illium to start the assignment. You will need Miranda on your squad.

missions.name: Eclipse Engineer
missions.description: A group of Eclipse mercenaries attack as you land the cab in the Transfer Station. The Eclipse engineer leading them tells you his captain, [megametracker://person?id=E2.Enyala], is close to capturing Oriana, and his snipers are moving into place to take down your squad. After you deal with him, there will be a fight with the remaining forces.

missions.name: Niket and Enyala
missions.description: Confront [megametracker://person?id=O2.Niket]. Whatever the outcome, a fight will ensue with the Eclipse captain, Enyala, and her forces.

missions.name: To Oriana
missions.description: End the mission by seeing Oriana and her family off to their new home, still safe from Miranda's father.

missions.name: Mordin: Old Blood
missions.description:
Mordin needs your help rescuing his former protege, Maelon, who has been kidnapped by Blood Pack mercenaries and is being held on Tuchanka. 

Before heading out to look for Maelon, you may want to acquire [megametracker://mission?id=A2.T.CombustionManifold] and [megametracker://mission?id=A2.T.MissingScout], both of which are accomplished during this assignment.

options.trigger: "Remind me." and "That's impressive work." and "That's horrific!" and "I don't buy that."
"Remind me." and "That's impressive work." and "Damn right it did."

conversationRewards.context: Examining the dead human just inside the Weyrloc facility

options.trigger: Blow up pipe, incinerating Klanspeaker and nearby krogan.
"That sounded religious." and "You had a crisis of faith." and "How do you deal with that?"

set.context: After selecting Renegade on either above
After selecting Paragon on either above

options.trigger: "Weyrloc is controlling him." and "He betrayed you."
"It was his fault." or "Found a spot of racism?"

set.context: Final decision on the research data (Game 3 consequences)

options.trigger: "You should help the krogan." or "Hold onto the data."
"Genophage was the right call." or "Destroy the data for now."

missions.name: Take Transport
missions.description: Head over to the mechanic and use the transport there to travel out to the Weyrloc facility.

missions.name: Hospital Approach
missions.description: You will have to fight Blood Pack mercenaries through the Tuchanka ruins in order to reach the Weyrloc facility. You can also find the Combustion Manifold, if you have that assignment.

missions.name: Hospital Interior
missions.description: Inside the facility, inbetween fights with Clan Weyrloc, you will uncover clues to Maelon's true purpose here. You can also find the Missing Scout, if you have that assignment. In the final battle, you will face [Chief Weyrloc Guld|megametracker://person?id=E2.Guld].

missions.name: Maelon
missions.description: There is no battle waiting inside the laboratory, but in the final bitter confrontation between Mordin and Maelon, you will again face one of the most crucial and ethically confounding plot lines in the game, the krogan Genophage, and choose to save or destroy Maelon and/or his data.

missions.name: Samara: Ardat-Yakshi
missions.description: As Samara revealed when first meeting you, she is hunting an Ardat-Yakshi, a dangerous Asari serial killer. She feels personally responsible because this Ardat-Yakshi is her daughter, Morinth. Track down Morinth on Omega so Samara can kill her.

missions.name: Tali: Treason
missions.description: Tali is summoned before the Migrant Fleet on mysterious charges of treason. During her trial, it is revealed that her father was experimenting on live geth. The court demands that she board his ship the Alarei and locate evidence of what happened and that she was not involved.

missions.name: Thane: Sins of the Father
missions.description: Thane abandoned his son Kolyat as a boy when pursuing the people who murdered Kolyat's mother Irikah. Kolyat has decided to follow in his father's footsteps and become an assassin. Thane wants to find him on the Citadel and stop him.

missions.name: Pets
missions.sideEffects: Keeping the Prejek Paddlefish alive throughout Game 3 and New Game+ results in an Intel Bonus from Liara after the Mars Mission (10% Weapon or Power Damage). It also becomes a War Asset.

missions.name: Model Ships
missions.description: The Normandy SR2 is already included in your collection.
